intro: Cheiradenia imthurnii, commonly known as the Kauai ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and woody structure. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
